intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Ugh, my poor feet. I've got blisters the size of eggs!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Oh, it's not so bad, Lissa. Just a healthy little stroll! How are you holding up, Robin?

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: My legs feel like pudding... Your endurance astounds me, Chrom.

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: You can carry me! ...No, seriously. I would really be okay with you carrying me.

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: Is something troubling you, Hierarch? You keep glancing up at the peaks.

intro.speaker: Hierarch
intro.line: Hmm? Oh, I'm just a b-bit nervous I'm afraid. Gh-ghastly times, these!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: The hierarch? He's been a friend of House Ylisse for many years. He guided Emmeryn during the early years of her rule. Why do you ask?

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: I can't quite put my finger on it, but something feels…

intro.speaker: Plegian
intro.line: Grah ha hah! Time to die, princey!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Plegian soldiers? Damn! How did they know we were here? Everyone! Prepare for battle!

battle.speaker: Vasto
battle.line: *Sniiiiiiff* Ahhhhhhhhh... Smell that, men? The winds of fortune are blowing our way!

battle.speaker: Hierarch
battle.line: Hold, sir! I am the man King Gangrel told you about! Did you not receive orders to take me into your protection?

battle.speaker: Vasto
battle.line: I've orders to protect a man, true... But I see no man here! ...Only a pig! A rasher of traitorous bacon that sold out his own sovereign! And what do we do with little piggies, mmm?

battle.speaker: Hierarch
battle.line: Well, you... I mean, perhaps... You let them go free?

battle.speaker: Vasto
battle.line: Oh, are you a chicken now? Bawk bawk! We've a whole barnyard in our midst! Well, it don't matter what you are. The axe will fall just the same!

battle.speaker: Vasto
battle.line: Right! Now for the main event. By moon's end, they'll be erecting statues of me in the capital! Ho there! Ylisseans! Give me the Fire Emblem and your wench of a ruler, and spare yourselves a gory end!

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: Phila, take Emmeryn to the rear of the column. We'll fend off these blackguards!

battle.speaker: Cordelia
battle.line: Huff, huff...* No! Plegians here as well?! Prince Chrom! Captain Phila! Beware! Enemy reinforcements to the rear! They'll be upon us soon!

battle.speaker: Phila
battle.line: She's one of my knights. Young yet, but quite gifted. But she was stationed on the border... Why...? Oh, gods! Could it mean...?

character-falls.speaker: Cordelia
character-falls.line: Nngh! Curse me, I am weak! I must retreat...

boss.speaker: Vasto
boss.line: I'll splatter you across the canyon floor!

boss.speaker: Vasto
boss.line: You doves think...killing me will change anything? Heh... Even now, my brothers storm across your precious border... Go on, dear exalted coward! Run! Flee while they slaughter your subjects! Save yourself... Let their faith in you...bleed away...with the rest...

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: ...They're gone.

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: Your Grace! My prince! Run! As far and fast as you can! More Plegians are coming, not a half day's march behind you!

end.speaker: Phila
end.line: Cordelia, what are you doing here? ...Tell me the border remains secure!

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: That I could, milady! But it would be false... Gangrel himself led his might against us! The end was upon us when my knight-sisters begged me fly and warn the exalt... I should have stayed... I should have stayed! Ah, gods, I can still hear the screams…

end.speaker: Phila
end.line: Peace, Cordelia. You did your duty. The sisters rightly prized your youth. You've many years yet to keep their legacy alive.

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: But I abandoned them! I'm weak... Their legacy deserves better.

end.speaker: Phila
end.line: Sometimes fleeing takes the most courage. They knew that. Now pull yourself together. Let the faith they showed in you give you strength.

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: Captain Phila, I... How can I go on like this? They were my...my family... *sob* Gods... Oh, gods…

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Damn those monsters!

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: I must return to the capital.

end.speaker: Phila
end.line: Your Grace, I cannot advise—

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: I should never have left. If it's discovered I'm away when this news comes to light... The people could panic. Riot. More Ylisseans could needlessly die. Here, Chrom. I entrust this to you.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: The Fire Emblem?

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: Take it to Ferox—to safety.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: And leave you? No, Emm.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: No part of House Ylisse matters more than the Emblem. It possesses tremendous power. But too much blood has been shed over it already. I hope it finds a better guardian in you than it did me.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Emm, come on. You can't... Don't talk like that! You sound like you're ready to give up…

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: I am not giving up, Chrom. I am only giving what I can.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Emm, please! This is madness!

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: Sis, wait! Let me go with you!

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: Stay with Chrom, Lissa. I command it.

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: This isn't fair! It's not fair! I know our people need you, but we need you, too!

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: Dry your tears, love. This is not good-bye.

end.speaker: Phila
end.line: Your Grace, the pegasus knights will accompany you to Ylisstol.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: Very well, Phila. Thank you.

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: I will keep the prince and princess safe, Your Grace. You have my word.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: I know you will, Frederick. Thank you.

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: It is my honor.

end.speaker: Phila
end.line: Cordelia. You will stay here with Chrom.

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: But, Captain—

end.speaker: Phila
end.line: I know your heart is heavy, but this is how it must be. Your knight-sisters will be with you in spirit, wherever you go.

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: ...May they give me strength. As you command, Captain. I will pray for your safety.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: Come, Phila. We must go.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: No! You don't have to go! This is absurd!

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: Chrom, you don't—

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Walking to your own death will not bring peace to anyone! Ylisse needs you. WE need you! Be selfish for once in your life!

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: ...... I love you, Chrom. Both you and Lissa are my everything. As for the peace I seek... You cannot see who it is for. I have to go. I'm sorry—I truly am. Let us embrace again in Ylisstol when you arrive with Feroxi reinforcements. I know you will come.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: ...This is a terrible plan.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: The blood of the first exalt flows strong in us. You and I will keep Ylisse safe. I believe it with all my heart. Safe journey, Chrom. Safe journey, Lissa.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Emm... Emm?! Ah...

dialogue.speaker: Lissa
dialogue.line: B-but she's safe inside the castle, right? Phila and the others will protect her! And Khan Flavia is assembling her best troops as we speak. We'll make it back home in time. I know we will!

dialogue.speaker: Lissa
dialogue.line: Chrom? Say something! Say, "Yes, of course we will!"

dialogue.speaker: Chrom
dialogue.line: ...I'm sorry, Lissa. What?

dialogue.speaker: Lissa
dialogue.line: Ugh, fine! Never mind! Let me know when you get out of your own head for a second!

dialogue.speaker: Sumia
dialogue.line: Snap out of it, Captain!

dialogue.speaker: Chrom
dialogue.line: OW! ...What the hell was that for?!

dialogue.speaker: Sumia
dialogue.line: Oh no! ...Did I do it wrong? Captain Phila said sometimes a good slap will break someone out of their doldrums.

dialogue.speaker: Lissa
dialogue.line: Sumia, when you slap someone, you do it with an open palm. You just punched Chrom in the face!

dialogue.speaker: Sumia
dialogue.line: Um... It's the thought that counts?

dialogue.speaker: Chrom
dialogue.line: Gods, that seriously hurt…

dialogue.speaker: Flavia
dialogue.line: Ha ha! What's wrong, my dear prince? Sometimes love hurts! You're lucky to have strong women like these, and not just dainty flowers about. In any case, I bring good news. The Feroxi army has finally mobilized. Every last man is itching to fight. I must say, I'm looking forward to savoring a skirmish or two myself.

dialogue.speaker: Chrom
dialogue.line: ...Wait. You're coming along?

dialogue.speaker: Flavia
dialogue.line: Of course! A khan must have her fun. I'm even bringing my insignificant other.

dialogue.speaker: Robin
dialogue.line: Your who?

dialogue.speaker: Flavia
dialogue.line: Basilio. The oaf isn't good for much, but he might stop a few stray arrows.

dialogue.speaker: Basilio
dialogue.line: Chrom! Good gods, I've been looking for you everywhere!

dialogue.speaker: Chrom
dialogue.line: Is something wrong?

dialogue.speaker: Basilio
dialogue.line: Our scouts have reported back. Dark news, I'm afraid... Ylisstol...has fallen.

dialogue.speaker: Chrom
dialogue.line: What?!

dialogue.speaker: Basilio
dialogue.line: The Plegians captured your exalt and retreated back across their lines. Gangrel has declared she's to be publicly executed within the moon.

dialogue.speaker: Chrom
dialogue.line: E-executed?!

dialogue.speaker: Lissa
dialogue.line: Ooooh…

dialogue.speaker: Robin
dialogue.line: Lissa? Lissa!

dialogue.speaker: Flavia
dialogue.line: The dastard's not even trying to be subtle anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Robin
dialogue.line: I agree. It's an obvious trap.

dialogue.speaker: Basilio
dialogue.line: The Mad King knew our scouts would relay this information back. It's clearly a provocation—a hot brand to the buttocks! We should consider our options carefully before jumping to any—

dialogue.speaker: Chrom
dialogue.line: Shepherds! We march to Plegia!

dialogue.speaker: Basilio
dialogue.line: *Ahem* Well, that would be ONE option, yes... But perhaps we've seen enough royalty waltzing into traps for one war already, eh?

dialogue.speaker: Chrom
dialogue.line: I don't care if it's a trap, Basilio. He's going to murder my sister!

dialogue.speaker: Flavia
dialogue.line: Peace, Chrom. Breathe a moment. No one's suggesting we don't act. We're simply saying we should act WISELY. We'll need guts AND wits in equal measure if we're to save your sister.

dialogue.speaker: Robin
dialogue.line: The khans are right. I'll think of something, Chrom. I promise.

dialogue.speaker: Chrom
dialogue.line: ...All right, Robin. I leave it to you to formulate our strategy.

dialogue.speaker: Flavia
dialogue.line: Are you certain you're up to the task, Robin? It won't be easy. You hold the exalt's life in one hand, and all of ours in the other.

dialogue.speaker: Robin
dialogue.line: A responsibility I do not take lightly. But I am equal to the challenge.

dialogue.speaker: Flavia
dialogue.line: Ha ha! You've got stones, at least. I like that!

dialogue.speaker: Basilio
dialogue.line: No hesitation, no mincing words... He's/She's either a genius or a fool! I suppose we'll find out once we march. Hold on to your tassets, Ylisseans. We've an exalt to save!
